common.copy_get_started: Copy the code to get started

banner.title: More than just an accordion
banner.description: Prismium allows you to create the most modern accordion in just a few clicks, which will suit any design (since you can decide for yourself how it will look, or use preset themes).

easy_to_use.title: Easy to use
easy_to_use.description: Simple and intuitive API that allows you to quickly and easily create accordions. You don't have to worry about how it works under the hood, just use it.

available_for.title: Prismium is available for
available_for.description: Prismium is a library that works with any framework supporting Vanilla JS. You can use Prismium with React, Vue, and other frameworks. Just import the library and use it in your project.

select_you_theme.title: Choose your Prismium style
select_you_theme.description: Or create your own stylish accordion using CSS. Prismium allows you to easily customize the accordion styles to match your design. You can use preset themes or create your own.

animations.title: Use modern animations
animations.description: Additionally, you always have the option to implement a custom animation.

attention.title: Attention to the details
attention.description:
Control even the smallest details of your application.
Prismium lets you customize every aspect of your application to make it unique. You can adjust colors, fonts, sizes, margins, animations, icons, and much more.

accessibility.title: Excellent accessibility
accessibility.description: Thanks to modern technologies, Prismium is accessible to all users. It offers themes for people with visual impairments, as well as RTL support.

compatibility.title: Compatibility with any browsers
compatibility.description: Prismium supports all modern browsers and devices. We test Prismium on all popular browsers and devices to ensure that the library works flawlessly.
compatibility.description_2: Additionally, you can use Prismium on mobile devices and tablets. Prismium adapts to any screen size and resolution to provide the best user experience.

use_prismium.title: Use Prismium in the most unexpected places
use_prismium.description: With Prismium you can create not only regular accordions but also many other interface elements. For example, you can use it to create filters, cards, product comparisons, etc.

seo.title: Flexible and customizable accordions for Vue, React, and JavaScript
seo.description: A simple and powerful tool for creating beautiful, responsive accordions with support for Vue, React, and Vanilla JavaScript. Start with Prismium today!

seo.title: How to create an accordion with Prismium: A guide for JavaScript, React, and Vue
seo.description: Easily start using Prismium in your project with simple import and configuration. Supports Vue, React, and Vanilla JS for flexibility and customization.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: There are several ways to install Prismium in your project. It all depends on your preferences and project requirements.

npm.title: Installation via NPM
npm.theme_desc: By default, Prismium is imported without themes and modules. If the standard functionality is insufficient, you will need to import the necessary modules and themes.
npm.theme_desc_2: If you don't want to import modules or themes, you can use Prismium with all modules and themes by default. However, this may result in a larger bundle size.

download.title: Download Prismium resources
download.description: If you want to use Prismium locally, you can download the resources from the website: jsdelivr.com

html.title: Adding the HTML template of Prismium
html.description: Let's add the basic Prismium template to your application:

styles.title: Customizing Prismium styles and sizes
styles.description: Most likely, you will need to customize Prismium; it is very simple – use the classes defined in the HTML Prismium, or your own that you define. List of main classes.
styles.description_2: If you don't need extensive customization of Prismium, the basic CSS variables might be sufficient. You can check the list via this link. By the way, Prismium themes are fully implemented using the library's basic CSS variables, so nothing prevents you from easily creating your own theme.

next.title: What next?
next.description: As you can see, Prismium is very easy to use and customize. You can start using it in your project as soon as you add and initialize the library. But this is just the beginning!
list: Check out ready-made demo cases of Prismium
Try implementing your own Prismium using the constructor
If you have any questions, ask them on StackOverflow or in Prismium Discussions
If you find an error or have a suggestion to improve Prismium, create an issue on GitHub

seo.title: Prismium API documentation for Vanilla JavaScript
seo.description: Explore the full Prismium API documentation for Vanilla JavaScript. Gain insights on customization and configuration of accordions in pure JavaScript projects.

icons.title: Icon options for Prismium
icons.description: Prismium supports adding static and dynamic icons, as well as icons via sprites. You have 3 ways to add an icon:

static.title: Static icon
static.description: Supports any format and HTML tag. For example: `svg`, `button`, `span`, `img`, etc.

sprite.title: Dynamic SVG sprite
sprite.description: Supports only SVG sprites. Requires specifying the sprite path. Learn more.

dynamic.title: Dynamic icon
dynamic.description: Supports any format and HTML tag, similar to a static icon. No additional parameters required.

styles.title: Prismium styles
styles.description: The Prismium library includes preset CSS and SCSS styles

css.title: CSS styles
css.prismium_bundle_css: set of all Prismium styles, including themes
css.prismium_bundle_min_css: minified set of all Prismium styles, including themes

scss.title: SCSS styles
scss.prismium_scss_bundle: set of all Prismium styles, including themes

themes.title: Prismium Themes
themes.dark: dark theme, inspired by fresh asphalt on F1 tracks
themes.light: light theme with a touch of ease
themes.forest: light theme inspired by the bamboo grove in Arashiyama
themes.ocean: light theme inspired by the Indian ocean
themes.sunset: light theme inspired by sunsets in Sydney

initialization.title: Initialization of Prismium in the project
initialization.description: Great, we have implemented the HTML template of Prismium and linked the necessary styles. Now you can start initialization.
initialization.description2: To initialize Prismium, you need to call the class Prismium(element, parameters)
initialization.element: HTMLElement or a string (CSS selector). Required parameter!
initialization.after_init: After initializing Prismium, you will have access to its instance through the HTMLElement:

init.description: Parameter for auto-initialization of Prismium immediately after class invocation.

opened.description: Determines whether Prismium will be open by default.

disabled.description: Determines whether interaction with Prismium is enabled by default. Disables interaction (opening/closing) even via methods!

theme.description: Sets the Prismium theme from available sets.

speed.description: Sets the animation speed for opening and closing Prismium.

auto_close.description: Determines if Prismium will close when other first-level Prismium are opened.

auto_close_nested.description: Determines if nested Prismium will close when other nested Prismium within the parent are opened.

get_parent_height.description: Determines the source of height when opening. Necessary for smooth accordion animation; by default, the height is taken from the content's height (by default `[data-prismium-content]`). When set to `true`, the height will be taken from the parent element (by default `[data-prismium]`).

scroll_to.description: Determines whether Prismium will scroll the page to the element being opened.

sprite_path.description: Required to support icon switching in Prismium via sprite on opening/closing.

icon_attribute.description: Specifies the attribute that will be used for the HTML element icon. Only data and HTML attributes are allowed.

container_selectors.description: Specifies the selectors that will be used to find the Prismium container.

current_selector.description: Specifies the selector for the element that will be used to open Prismium.

content_selector.description: Specifies the selector for the element that will be used to locate the content inside Prismium.

hidden_selector.description: Specifies the selector for the element that will be used to find the technical container of Prismium. The container is not required in the DOM. See the full HTML template.

active_class.description:
Specifies the active class for Prismium. It can be used to set the active state.
Not recommended to change! It is used in the default Prismium styles.
active_class.note:
To set the active state of Prismium by default, add the class `prismium-active` to the element `[data-prismium]`.
For example:

opened_class.description:
Specifies the class for the technical container of Prismium after it is fully expanded.
Not recommended to change! It is used in the default Prismium styles.

disabled_class.description:
Specifies the class for a disabled Prismium. It can be used to set the disabled state. It does not affect the open/closed state of Prismium by default.
Not recommended to change! It is used in the default Prismium styles.
disabled_class.note:
To set the disabled state of Prismium by default, add the class `prismium-disabled` to the element `[data-prismium]`.
For example:

on.description: Used to set events on the Prismium instance.

on_any.description: Adds an event listener that will trigger for all events.

effect.description:
Used to set the opening/closing effect for Prismium.
Available effects: `line-by-line`, `fade-scale`, `slide`, `stagger`, `wave`, `flip`, `zoom`, `cascade`, `custom`. Requires the effects module. If you are using the bundle, it is already included.

effect_selectors.description: Specifies the selectors that will be used to find elements for the effect. By default, Prismium animates the first children from `[data-prismium-content]`

effect_ignore.description: Specifies elements with a selector that will be ignored in the effect animation.

effect_custom.description:
Used to create a custom opening/closing effect.
  • `speed` — required for proper calculation of the animation endpoint. Available via `prismium.effect.open` in events.
  • `delay` — required for proper calculation of the animation endpoint. Available via `prismium.effect.delay` in events.
  • `setup` — event that triggers immediately before closing or opening the Prismium instance.
    • `prismium` — the Prismium instance.
    • `children` — child HTML element
    • `index` — index of the child, starting from 0.
    • `total` — total count of children with the effect
    • `isOpening` — indicates whether Prismium is opening or closing
  • `open` — event that triggers when the Prismium instance opens.
    • `prismium` — the Prismium instance.
    • `children` — child HTML element
    • `index` — index of the child, starting from 0.
    • `total` — total count of children with the effect
  • `close` — event that triggers when the Prismium instance closes.
    • `prismium` — the Prismium instance.
    • `children` — child HTML element
    • `index` — index of the child, starting from 0.
    • `total` — total count of children with the effect
  • `cleanup` — event that triggers immediately after closing or opening the Prismium instance. Typically used to clean up previously set styles.
    • `prismium` — the Prismium instance.
    • `children` — child HTML element
    • `index` — index of the child, starting from 0.
    • `total` — total count of children with the effect
    • `isOpening` — indicates whether Prismium is opening or closing

init.description: Initializes a Prismium instance on the given element `el`.

use.description: Registers a module to be used by Prismium.

get_instance.description: Retrieves the Prismium instance for the given element `el`.

open_all.description: Opens all Prismium instances in the selected container by the selector `selector` (by default `'.prismium'`)

open_everything.description: Opens all Prismium instances on the page by selector. By default, it opens all Prismium instances.

close_all.description: Closes all Prismium instances in the selected container by the selector `selector` (by default `'.prismium'`)

close_everything.description: Closes all Prismium instances on the page by selector. By default, it closes all Prismium instances.

close_nested.description: Closes all nested Prismium instances within the selected instance.

disable.description: Disables interaction with a Prismium instance. Disables interaction (opening/closing) even via methods!

setup_speed.description:
Sets the opening/closing speed of Prismium.
`open` — opening speed, `close` — closing speed

once.description: Adds an event handler that will be called only once. If multiple handlers are added, the handler will be automatically removed after the first call.

on_any.description: Adds a handler for all events.

off.description:
Removes event handlers.
If only a list of events is provided (without a handler), all handlers for those events are removed.
If a handler is also provided, only that specific handler is removed.

off_any.description: Removes the handler for all events.

events.title: Prismium Events
events.description: Prismium has many useful events that you can listen to. Events can be assigned in two ways:

list.init: Use the `on` parameter when initializing Prismium:
list.method: Use the `on` method after initializing Prismium:

events.note: Note that the keyword `this` in the handler always refers to the Prismium instance, not the element on which it was called.

before_init.description: Event triggered before the instance is initialized.

init.description: Event triggered when the instance is initialized.

after_init.description: Event triggered immediately after the instance is initialized.

before_open.description: Event triggered before the instance opens.

open.description: Event triggered when the instance opens.

after_open.description: Event triggered immediately after the instance opens.

before_close.description: Event triggered before the instance closes.

close.description: Event triggered when the instance closes.

after_close.description: Event triggered immediately after the instance closes.

before_destroy.description: Event triggered before the instance is destroyed.

destroy.description: Event triggered when the instance is destroyed.

after_destroy.description: Event triggered immediately after the instance is destroyed.

effect_start.description:
Event triggered at the start of the opening/closing effect.
`direction` — effect direction, either `'open'` or `'close'`

effect_end.description:
Event triggered at the end of the opening/closing effect.
`'direction'` — effect direction, either `'open'` or `'close'`

ts.title: TypeScript Definitions
ts.description: Prismium is fully typed and exports definitions for `Prismium` and `PrismiumOptions`:

404.title: Error 404.
404.description: Unfortunately, this page does not exist. The address may have been entered incorrectly or the page was deleted. Try returning to the home page.

500.title: Error 500.
500.description: Unfortunately, an internal server error occurred. We are already working on a fix. Please try returning to the home page or refreshing the page later.

000.title: Error {code}.
000.description: Unfortunately, an error occurred. We are already working on a fix. Try returning to the home page or refreshing the page later.
